_comment: DO NOT EDIT: FILE GENERATED AUTOMATICALLY BY PTERODACTYL PANEL - PTERODACTYL.IO
name: Hytale Alpha
author: josueplayerrs@gmail.com

installation.script:
#!/bin/bash
set -euo pipefail

echo "== Hytale Installer =="

# =========================
# Configuration
# =========================
SERVER_DIR="/mnt/server"

DOWNLOADER_URL="https://downloader.hytale.com/hytale-downloader.zip"
DOWNLOADER_ZIP="hytale-downloader.zip"
DOWNLOADER_BIN="hytale-downloader-linux-amd64"

GAME_ARCHIVE="hytale-download.zip"

FILES_TO_REMOVE=(
    "$DOWNLOADER_ZIP"
    "$GAME_ARCHIVE"
    ".hytale-downloader-credentials.json"
    "hytale-downloader-windows-amd64.exe"
)

# =========================
# Functions
# =========================
log() {
    echo "[Hytale] $1"
}

install_dependencies() {
    log "Installing required dependencies..."
    apt-get update
    apt-get install -y curl unzip
}

# =========================
# Start
# =========================
log "Applying permissions to $SERVER_DIR..."
chmod -R 755 "$SERVER_DIR"

cd "$SERVER_DIR"

install_dependencies

# =========================
# Download & Extract Downloader
# =========================
log "Downloading Hytale downloader..."
curl -fsSL "$DOWNLOADER_URL" -o "$DOWNLOADER_ZIP"

log "Extracting downloader..."
unzip -o "$DOWNLOADER_ZIP"

if [[ ! -f "$DOWNLOADER_BIN" ]]; then
    log "ERROR: $DOWNLOADER_BIN not found after extraction"
    exit 1
fi

chmod +x "$DOWNLOADER_BIN"

# =========================
# Run Downloader
# =========================
log "Running Hytale downloader..."
./"$DOWNLOADER_BIN" -download-path "$GAME_ARCHIVE"

if [[ ! -f "$GAME_ARCHIVE" ]]; then
    log "ERROR: $GAME_ARCHIVE was not generated"
    exit 1
fi

# =========================
# Extract Game
# =========================
log "Extracting game files..."
unzip -o "$GAME_ARCHIVE"

# =========================
# Cleanup
# =========================
log "Cleaning up temporary files..."
for file in "${FILES_TO_REMOVE[@]}"; do
    rm -f "$file"
done

log "Installation completed successfully!"
